I've always felt that each test should exist as standalone thing.
They can =
have a setup and teardown method.  Maybe a set of tests in a
suite share so=
me set up and tear down stuff.

What it looks like here is your tests are d=
ependent on a nightly job
to run and worst their order.  It has always been=
 my understanding
that each test is order independent.  I remember early on=
 stuff saying
that one was not guaranteed what order the tests would run in=
.
Granted I think this randomization was never done, but it was made to
sho=
w a concept.  The concept being, a person should be able to run a
given fai=
led test over and over (with some of source under test having
modifications=
) until it passes.  There should not be a whole series of
steps that have t=
o run in order to get a single test to pass.

I can speak from experience, =
requiring a procedure of tests to run
inorder to get the desired results le=
ads to tests that are turned off
or forgotten about.

I have some questions=
...

Are you testing the nightly job?
Could the initialization for Test2.my=
Test() actually be setup in a
setup method?  --Then no need to rely on the =
nightly job.

something you should consider...
- "Ideally, each test case i=
s independent from the others" --
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unit_Test
--=
 Along these lines, the results of one test should not dictate the
results =
of another.

Hope I added some insight,

Big Mike
